most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
pieces-for-developers crashes at startup on ubuntu 24.04 LTS

common_issues.title: Pieces fails to start after update on Linux and Windows
common_issues.description: Users on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS and Windows 11 report Pieces failing to start after recent updates. On Linux, the application crashes at startup with XCB errors. On Windows, it hangs at "Ensure Core Dependencies" screen.  Reinstallation doesn't resolve the issue. Logs indicate potential conflicts with GTK+ versions on Linux.

related_issues.title: pieces-for-developers crashes at startup on ubuntu 24.04 LTS
related_issues.text:
pieces-for-developers crashes at startup on ubuntu 24.04 LTS
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I launch pieces-for-developers a window briefly appears and then disappears. 

The first time after I reboot a blank window appears and Ubuntu displayed the "application not responding" dialog. No matter how many times I clicked "wait" it never appeared to start. I've not been able to reproduce however and now the blank window appears and almost immediately disappears

System is running Ubuntu 24.04 LTS using X11 with nvidia device drivers

pieces-os           12.2.1            (105)   1GB -
pieces-for-developers 4.3.3            (94) 173MB

The `~/.local/share/com.pieces.os` folder does not appear to have been created

Output from when starting with debug flag

```
pieces-for-developers --debug
Gtk-Message: 08:24:44.749: Not loading module "atk-bridge": The functionality is provided by GTK natively. Please try to not load it.

(pieces_for_x:12556): Gtk-WARNING **: 08:24:44.845: GTK+ module /snap/pieces-for-developers/94/gnome-platform/usr/lib/gtk-2.0/modules/libcanberra-gtk-module.so cannot be loaded.
GTK+ 2.x symbols detected. Using GTK+ 2.x and GTK+ 3 in the same process is not supported.
Gtk-Message: 08:24:44.845: Failed to load module "canberra-gtk-module"

(pieces_for_x:12556): Gtk-WARNING **: 08:24:44.846: GTK+ module /snap/pieces-for-developers/94/gnome-platform/usr/lib/gtk-2.0/modules/libcanberra-gtk-module.so cannot be loaded.
GTK+ 2.x symbols detected. Using GTK+ 2.x and GTK+ 3 in the same process is not supported.
Gtk-Message: 08:24:44.846: Failed to load module "canberra-gtk-module"
RuntimeFlutterCodeHighlighter initialized with path: /snap/pieces-for-developers/94/lib/libruntime_code_highlighter.so
Debug: Starting logger initialization...
Debug: SimpleLogger configured with Level.ALL
Debug: SimpleLogger formatter configured
Debug: Sentry initialized
Debug: Sentry logger configured
Debug: Log directory initialized at: /home/dns/snap/pieces-for-developers/94/.local/share/com.pieces.os.dependency_management
Debug: About to complete initialization...
Debug: Initialization completed
INFO: [LOGGER::initialized] Logger initialized successfully with updated directory: /home/dns/Documents/com.pieces.pfd/production/logs
[xcb] Unknown sequence number while processing reply
[xcb] Most likely this is a multi-threaded client and XInitThreads has not been called
[xcb] Aborting, sorry about that.
pieces_for_x: ../../src/xcb_io.c:730: _XReply: Assertion `!xcb_xlib_threads_sequence_lost' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)
```

related_issues.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
related_issues.text: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update. stucks at loading ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1.0 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. For over a month I have been unable to use **Pieces OS** or **Pieces Desktop**. The Pieces OS service stopped working (I assume after the last update), and since then the desktop app no longer starts properly. Whenever I try to launch, the `Pieces` process starts but never progresses further. In **Pieces Desktop** I only see the message: _Ensure Core Dependencies Retry Step_ I’ve seen another user reporting a similar issue, but my case seems different (I’m attaching logs below). Unfortunately, this is not the first time I’ve faced problems with Pieces.... I’ve already lost all my history/snippets about three times in the past (distinct bugs). This situation is quite frustrating. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Install/update to the latest version of Pieces OS on Windows 11. 2. Launch Pieces Desktop. 3. Observe that the app does not open and gets stuck with the “Ensure Core Dependencies” message. ### Expected Behavior Pieces OS should start normally and allow Pieces Desktop to connect and function. ### Actual Behavior - Pieces OS process starts but hangs. - Pieces Desktop shows “Ensure Core Dependencies – Retry Step”. - Reinstalling from scratch does not solve the issue. ### System Information - **OS**: Windows 11 - **Processor**: Intel x64-based - **Pieces OS**: 12.2.1.0 - **Pieces Desktop**: 4.34 ### Troubleshooting Attempted - Tried reinstalling Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop from scratch → issue persists. - I noticed a similar issue has been reported, but I’m not sure it is directly related to what I’m experiencing. - I suspect that completely deleting all local data/configuration files could be a final solution, but this would cause me to lose all my snippets/history (which has already happened before). I’d prefer to avoid this unless it’s confirmed as the only fix. ### Logs [Support logs.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22142467/Support.zip) ### Additional... If this issue is already being tracked, that’s fine. If not, I’ll attempt to wipe all Pieces data and retry, though I suspect some leftover files/data may be blocking the reinstall. Thanks in advance for your support! Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate GTK+ version conflicts on Linux causing startup crashes (related to ticket #835).
Address the "Ensure Core Dependencies" hang on Windows startup (related to ticket #852).
Improve communication with users awaiting responses (1 pending ticket).
Prioritize bug fixes related to application startup failures across operating systems.
